column1: Conversation

How does this stock go higher and higher when their service is so poor, like no one cares who works for them. It's just a paycheck. All the cars I get from them are not what is in the pictures, many buyers like myself are not renewing memberships. I don't get it, who is buying the cars? I'm shorting at $150 something smells fishy, if you ever deal with Copart they do so many messed up things to customers. I don't get it.
Heres a chance to buy the dip!
Really like copart, new investor looking for stocks for the long term... thinking of buying soon? Could the stock price grow if held for long? What’s a good entry point?

I have been doing business with copart for almost 20 years now as a buyer. This company does not care about their buyers; I would say their second biggest customer after the insurance company. The have pretty much monetized their relationship with buyers and care less about addressing their issues or concerns. I would see this company doing well in the short run as a result but by no means this will a viable long term investment. The amount of buyer dissatisfaction with copart is probably at its highest, which will eventually cost the company really dollars. Let us buyers share our experiences in this form to see if we can deliver a message to copart because member services for sure don’t care.

Long 730 shares of CPRT at $104.26. This is a Pure Earnings play, bought my shares just a few hours ago, to hold through earnings release. Expecting a very good ER and an accompanying pop to the upside in stock price. I think $110 is very reasonable, but I am open for more. :-) Stock popped up before I got in, so not really happy with my fill price, but stock is trading up a little here in the AH session as we wait for the ER, which is due just before 6:00 PM ET. Best Wishes to All. :-)
Last week I indicated this would pull back to the $86-$90 range! Here we are and looks like time to pick some up!

Good earnings. Expected though to be trading at the insane multiple it trades at. No dividend. No cash returned to investors, no stock buybacks announced. Nothing. Just insider sales. I don’t see a reason to own it as the pandemic helped them and this is fluff.
Someone wanted to scary shareholders after hours but earnings are very good and the future is bright so there is no reason to sell at these low premarket prices

CPRT is rocking on their excellent quarterly earnings!!!Copart, Inc. CPRT delivered a comprehensive beat in first-quarter fiscal 2020 (ended Oct 31), wherein it managed to surpass earnings and revenue estimates. Rising service revenues across markets served by the company and expanding network of facilities have aided the results.The Texas-based online vehicle auctioning company reported adjusted earnings per share of 65 cents, surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 59 cents and increasing from the year-ago figure of 47 cents. Markedly, this is the fifth consecutive earnings beat for the company. Higher-than-expected service revenues led to the outperformance. Precisely, service revenues came in at $487.8 million, outpacing the consensus estimate of $462 million. Copart, Inc. Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise Copart, Inc. Price, Consensus and EPS SurpriseCopart, Inc. Price, Consensus and EPS SurpriseCopart, Inc. price-consensus-eps-surprise-chart | Copart, Inc. QuoteTotal revenues came in at $554.4 million, surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $531 million. The top line was also 20.2% higher than the year-ago figure of $461.4 million. While service revenues accounted for nearly 88% of total revenues, vehicle sales totaled $66.5 million during the quarter under review, almost flat with the year-ago level.Gross profit was up roughly 30% year over year to $254.8 million. Total operating expenses rose to $349 million from $309.9 million recorded in the prior-year period. Operating income increased to $205.4 million from $151.4 million reported a year ago.Copart — whose peers include Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers Incorporated RBA, Byd Co., Ltd. BYDDY and Liquidity Services Inc. LQDT — had cash and cash equivalents of $181.1 million as of Oct 31, 2019. Long-term debt, revolving loan facility and capital lease obligations were $400 million. Its debt-to-capital ratio stands at 17.2%. During the quarter, the Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) firm generated net cash flow of $212.4 million from operations compared with $107.7 million in the prior-year period. You can see the complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.

I started a very small position today based on CPRT being the only game in town.And they are very abusive IMO towards purchasers. Their ability to add on fee's is impressive, these folks could have a future as a gov't agency!CPRT is basically up 70% basically in a straight line this Year. At this time of Year I mostly buy tax loss Company's not winners.However I did add a little WTR today also.Very slow MB here at CPRT. And never anything positive about dealing with these folks. So I thought I'd try and profit from that.
met earnings ...slight miss on revenue.....good report

I listened to the investor call, They have done very well to bring in buyers to bid on the insurance inventory. They keep raising the buyer fees and increase in their inventory from both insurance and others. about an 80% of inventory from insurance. Their most important customer is the insurance companies since they supply them with the inventory.
What's going on with earnings?

Great company not a proponent of selling if you’re going long however don’t buy into the earnings which will nosedive. Reason; people are driving and therefore not wrecking cars insurance claim counts fell off a cliff. This is great for the insurance companies however horrible for Copart.Without automobile accidents they can’t collect fees on storage and they can’t auction cars if nobody’s buying.

Copart Reports Second Quarter Fiscal 2020 Financial Results5:55 PM ET 2/19/20 | BusinessWireDALLAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 19, 2020--Copart, Inc. (NASDAQ: CPRT) today reported financial results for the quarter ended January 31, 2020.For the three months ended January 31, 2020, revenue, gross profit, and net income were $575.1 million, $259.9 million, and $168.7 million, respectively. These represent an increase in revenue of $90.2 million, or 18.6%; an increase in gross profit of $51.7 million, or 24.8%; and an increase in net income of $37.3 million, or 28.4%, respectively, from the same period last year. Fully diluted earnings per share for the three months were $0.71 compared to $0.55 last year, an increase of 29.1%.For the six months ended January 31, 2020, revenue, gross profit, and net income were $1.1 billion, $514.8 million, and $386.9 million, respectively. These represent an increase in revenue of $183.3 million, or 19.4%; an increase in gross profit of $110.6 million, or 27.4%; and an increase in net income of $141.4 million, or 57.6%, respectively, from the same period last year. Fully diluted earnings per share for the six months were $1.62 compared to $1.01 last year, an increase of 60.4%.Excluding the impact of discrete income tax items, disposal of non-operating assets, foreign currency-related gains, certain income tax benefits and payroll taxes related to accounting for stock option exercises, and the effect on common equivalent shares from ASU 2016-09, non-GAAP fully diluted earnings per share for the three and six months ended January 31, 2020 and 2019, were $0.65, $0.52, $1.30 and $0.99, respectively. A reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable financial measures computed in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) can be found in the tables attached to this press release.

My next Pure Earnings play is going to be CPRT to the Long side. Sometime tomorrow I plan to sell all my DVN shares. I certainly hope at a profit, and immediately jump into CPRT, to hold through earnings release Thursday AH. I think CPRT is a very interesting, successful, and well-managed company. Analysts seem to think there is limited upside potential from current price levels, but I tend to disagree. I think a very good ER tomorrow, could easily lift this stock to the $110 level. Here is my analysis and reasoning for choosing this one as my Pure Earnings Play of the Day:CPRT: Very likely to beat consensus on both EPS and Revenue. Company is enjoying very good revenue growth that should continue through this quarter and the next. Company beat both EPS and Revenue consensus for the past 3 quarters. Excellent stock price reactions to its ER's: Only ONE significant Gap Down in their past ELEVEN ER's. Stock is close to a 52 week high right now, but a comprehensive examination of valuation indicates the stock is still fairly valued right now. i see no over-valuation, therefore the stock should respond well and go up, on a very good ER, which is what I am strongly expecting. To add to this likelihood, a comprehensive analysis of overall financials, indicates the company to be in very good shape. Debt-to-Equity ratio is very good, Gross Margin is good, Operating Margin is excellent. Return-on-Equity is excellent, and Growth Rate is good/very good. To conclude, this play seems to offer an excellent risk/reward ratio, with very good odds of success, a 4-7% upside move seems perfectly reasonable. Other plays I strongly considered for this date include FIVN Long, and MOS and MCS Short Sells. Warning: You could easily lose 10-30% of your capital on any Pure Earnings play, and so I do not recommend any such plays to anyone, except to myself, since I am my own best leader and follower. Do your own Due Diligence and don't do trades like this unless you feel comfortable risking a 30% capital loss in a single day. Best Wishes!
